name: Seared Summer Squash and Egg Tacos
description: These make great breakfast tacos, but I make them for dinner most often. Make sure to get the pan nice and hot for a delicious seared flavor.
recipeYield: 10 tacos, serving 5 as a main dish
keywords: dairy-free, gluten-free, healthy, high fiber, low cholesterol, low-sodium, nut-free, vegetarian, eggs, summer squash, tortilla, main course, summer
recipeIngredient: 1 small onion, cut in half lengthwise and sliced across the grain
1 1/2 pounds zucchini or other summer squash, diced

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a heavy skillet (preferably cast-iron) over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil and the onion and cook, stirring, until the onion begins to color, about 3 minutes. Add the zucchini and cook, stirring, until it is lightly colored and tender, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, chili and salt to taste and stir together for about 30 seconds to a minute, until fragrant. Reduce the heat to low.
Beat the eggs and season with salt and pepper. Add to the zucchini mixture along with the cilantro. Cook, stirring, until the eggs are set. Fill the warm tortillas and serve.
